article_title: MPD Arrests Two for Violent Gang Activity
article_text:
The Meridian Police Department’s Gang Unit has arrested two teenagers for multiple violent charges in the city. Nineteen-year-old Harvey Anderson is charged with two counts aggravated assault, causing a felony by a person under 17, shooting into an occupied vehicle and participating in or conducting gang activity.

Seventeen-year-old Demetrius Durr is also charged with two counts aggravated assault, participating in or conducting gang activity, and shooting into an occupied vehicle. Police say these arrests are in connection with a shooting that happened Nov. 23 of last year.

Investigators say they believe these two might be responsible for other shootings that have happened in the past year. They say these are the first in a series of arrests the gang unit plans to make in shootings around the city.

article_metadata.description: Two people have been arrested in connection with a shooting that happened last year.
article_metadata.author: Tom Williams
